turns.content: Mercedes-Benz finished 2022 with strong sales in Top-End and Battery Electric Vehicles (BEVs), with a total of 540,800 deliveries (+17%) in Q4. Despite ongoing COVID measures, semiconductor, and logistic bottlenecks, Mercedes-Benz Passenger Cars delivered 2,043,900 vehicles (-1%) to customers. BEV sales more than doubled to 117,800 units (+124%) in 2022, representing 15% of overall Mercedes-Benz Cars retail unit sales. Mercedes-Benz is on its way to an all-electric future, with plans for a high-power charging network of over 10,000 chargers worldwide. Top-End sales rose 14% in Q4 to 83,800 units, driven by AMG, Mercedes-Maybach, and G-Class. The EQS was successful in attracting new customers to the Top-End segment, with 19,200 deliveries to U.S. customers. Mercedes-Maybach achieved its best sales year with 21,600 units (+37%) delivered, with plans to become electric with the launch of the EQS SUV in 2023. Core luxury deliveries reached 1,101,800 units (+4%). The GLC was the best-selling model with 342,900 units (+3%) in 2022, with its successor model launching mid-year. The C-Class, E-Class, and CLA also performed well.
